a.span: Learning at home with BPS or Community Partners

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

strong.span: Boston Public Schools will remain closed through the 2019-20 school year due to the coronavirus pandemic.

p.span: Governor Baker announced on April 21, 2020, that all Massachusetts schools will remain closed through the remainder of the school year.
Our first priority will always be the safety and well-being of our students, families, and staff at Boston Public Schools.

BPS remains committed to providing equitable and meaningful learning opportunities for our students and has been developing plans to expand and improve upon our on-going remote learning efforts. Nothing is more important to us than our students, and we will remain unwavering in our efforts to ensure they get what they need for their health, safety, and continued learning.

span.strong: MCAS tests in all Massachusetts schools have been canceled this spring.

strong.a: View the latest BPS Weekly Update Newsletter

p.span: We want to know what your family’s needs are during school closure so we can better support you.

We are asking families to complete a short survey to let us know what they may need during this difficult school closure. On April 3rd, families were sent an email for each student enrolled at BPS with a personalized link to a survey. If you are a BPS parent and did not receive the survey in your email, click here to take the survey, which is available in 10 languages.
Even if you may not have a specific need, that is helpful for us to know. We want to hear from every BPS family.

span.strong: If you have questions, call the BPS helpline at 617-635-8873, Monday - Friday, 9 - 5 pm.

p.span: Dear McKinley School Community,
We’re calling to inform you that the Boston Public Schools has become aware that a member of the McKinley School community is being tested for the coronavirus.

Out of an abundance of caution, all McKinley Schools will be closed tomorrow, Monday, March 16th. At this time, we have no confirmed cases of coronavirus in your school community, but our top priority is to keep you safe and informed.
If you or anyone associated with the school develops fever, cough, or shortness of breath, please contact your doctor or the Boston Public Health Commission at the Mayor’s Healthline, 617-534-5050.
As a reminder, all Boston public schools will be closed starting Tuesday, March 17.
Nothing is more important than the safety and well-being of our students and staff.
As soon as we know more, we will let you know immediately.
Students can pick up their learning packets at a food distribution site closest to their home. Information about those locations will be available later this afternoon by email and on
Thank you.
Estimada Comunidad de la Escuela McKinley:
Estamos llamando para informarle que las Escuelas Públicas de Boston están al tanto de que un miembro de la comunidad de la escuela McKinley está siendo evaluado por el coronavirus.
Para tener la mayor precaución posible, todas las Escuelas McKinley estarán cerradas ma
ñ
ana, lunes 16 de marzo. Hasta estos momentos no tenemos confirmado ningún caso de coronavirus es su comunidad escolar, pero nuestra mayor prioridad es manternerlos seguros e informados.

Si usted o alguien asociado con la escuela llega a tener fiebre, tos o falta de respiración, por favor comuníquese con su médico o con la Comisión de Salud Pública de Boston, a la Línea de Salud del Alcalde, 617-534-5050.
Como recordatorio, todas las escuelas públicas de Boston cerrarán sus puertas a partir del martes 17 de marzo.
No hay nada más importante que la seguridad y bienestar de nuestros esdudiantes y empleados. Tan pronto sepamos algo más se lo comunicaremos de inmediato.

Los estudiantes podrán recoger sus materiales de aprendizaje en un centro de distribución de alimentos cercano a sus hogares. La información sobre esas localidades estará disponible esta tarde por correo electrónico y en
Muchas gracias.

div.p: English | Español | عربى | Kabuverdianu | 中文 | Français | Kreyòl | Português | Afsoomaali | tiếng Việt

a.aria-label: tiếng Việt - Opens a new window

div.p: BPS made a decision to close the Elliot K-8 until March 19, 2019. This closure was made after confirmation of one instance of a person, later confirmed as positive for the virus, having been present in the school environment prior to being tested or showing any symptoms. Although the public health experts confirmed that the risk of transmission remains very low, the school was closed in order to ensure that the BPS community remains safe.

p.a: Please click here to view the notification sent to the Eliot K-8 Community on the evening of March 11, 2020

p.span: Good evening,
This is the Boston Public Schools calling to inform you that schools will be open tomorrow, March 11. Staff and students should report to school as usual.
BPS, together with city and health officials, is continuing to closely monitor the evolving health crisis related to the coronavirus.
The Governor’s announcement of a state of emergency in Massachusetts allows him to make necessary decisions quickly during this difficult time. At this time, Boston Public Schools will remain open.
We will continue to update the community as information and new guidance becomes available.
Thank you.
To listen to this message again, press the star key.
Boston Public Schools has cancelled all school sponsored domestic travel per the recommendations of the Governor.

div.p: Updated staff attendance guidelines were sent to all City of Boston employees on the evening of March 6 from the Mayor's Office. Click here to view the temporary modifications to the staff attendance policy. (BPS sign-in required)
